docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican-controlled Legislature on Friday banned abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy, overriding the governor’s veto and joining 11 other states in prohibiting abortion at that point.

headline.main: West Virginia: Veto of Abortion Curb Is Overturned
headline.print_headline: West Virginia: Veto of Abortion Curb Is Overturned

docs.abstract: West Virginia Legislature bans abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy, overriding veto by Gov Earl Ray Tomblin.
docs.snippet: The Republican-controlled Legislature on Friday banned abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy, overriding the governor’s veto and joining 11 other states in prohibiting abortion at that point.

docs.lead_paragraph: Investors are showing increased interest in avoiding companies that clash with their beliefs and in putting money into projects that could do some good, whatever the return.

headline.main: Adding Good Deeds to the Investment Equation
headline.print_headline: Adding Good Deeds to the Investment Equation

docs.abstract: Wealth Matters column notes that plan by Richmond, Calif, to sell $3 million in social impact bonds is sign of how investors are increasingly interested in such projects; suggests that change in attitude toward social impact investing has been driven by research that shows it is similar to other investing, and that widely held view that social impact bonds had lower returns was misinformed.
docs.snippet: Investors are showing increased interest in avoiding companies that clash with their beliefs and in putting money into projects that could do some good, whatever the return.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Air Force on Wednesday kicked off a drive to attract and retain more women and minorities, including a push to increase the number of female officers and pilots.

headline.main: U.S. Air Force Launches Push to Recruit More Women and Minorities
headline.print_headline: U.S. Air Force Launches Push to Recruit More Women and Minorities

docs.lead_paragraph: Australia's High Court on Wednesday backed the broadcasting watchdog's finding that an Australian radio station broke the law with a prank call to a British hospital taking care of the pregnant Duchess of Cambridge, paving the way for penalties.

headline.main: Australian Court Backs Finding Radio Royal Prank Call Broke Law
headline.print_headline: Australian Court Backs Finding Radio Royal Prank Call Broke Law

docs.snippet: Australia's High Court on Wednesday backed the broadcasting watchdog's finding that an Australian radio station broke the law with a prank call to a British hospital taking care of the pregnant Duchess of Cambridge, paving the way for penalties.

docs.lead_paragraph: The raids were part of a federal inquiry into an industry that helps pregnant Chinese women travel to the United States to deliver babies who will have American citizenship.

headline.main: California Apartments Raided in Federal Investigation of Chinese ‘Birth Tourism’
headline.print_headline: California Apartments Raided in Federal Investigation of Chinese ‘Birth Tourism’

docs.abstract: Federal agents raid 37 locations in southern California that they say are illegal 'birth factories' where Chinese women come to give birth so that their babies will gain United States citizenship; raid, largest carried out so far, is intended to crack down on birth tourism industry, not mothers themselves, since it is not illegal for foreigners to give birth in America.
docs.snippet: The raids were part of a federal inquiry into an industry that helps pregnant Chinese women travel to the United States to deliver babies who will have American citizenship.
